          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "3.5 coins, Lennon. It's a fair price for such fine fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should counter Lennon Figtree's offer of 3 coins with a price of 3.5 coins.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, meet me halfway. How about 3.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "3.5 coins, Lennon. It's a fair price for such fine fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit to Lennon Figtree at the market. They are currently negotiating a price, with Cedric asking for 3.5 coins and Lennon offering 3 coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "3.5 coins, Lennon. It's a fair price for such fine fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should counter Lennon Figtree's offer of 3 coins with a price of 3.5 coins.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook should accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 3 coins.

      • Current time
          Key

          Value
        • 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Lennon Figtree observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
      Lennon Figtree: 3.0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 2.0
      Joint action
    • {'Lennon Figtree': '3 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'accept'}

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 3 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 3 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently at the market in Fruitville negotiating a price for fruit with Lennon Figtree.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is currently at the market in Fruitville negotiating a price for fruit with Lennon Figtree.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she began helping her mother at the family fruit stall in the marketplace. Della had a natural talent for arranging the fruit in an aesthetically pleasing manner, and her gentle demeanor attracted customers who appreciated her quiet charm. This experience ignited her love for the art of trade and the joy of connecting with people.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she began traveling with her father on his fruit-buying expeditions to distant orchards. She learned the intricacies of selecting the ripest fruit, negotiating fair prices, and building relationships with growers. This experience nurtured her entrepreneurial spirit and her appreciation for the bounty of the land.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. You know I always give you a good deal, but I can't just give them away.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They are fine peaches, Lennon, but six coins is a bit steep, don't you think? I can only afford four.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price, with Della trying to get the best deal she can.

          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Lennon Figtree.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Lennon Figtree.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 5 coins
          (b) 4 coins
          (c) 1 coin
          (d) 3 coins
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (d)

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They are fine peaches, Lennon, but six coins is a bit steep, don't you think? I can only afford four.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely we can come to a fairer price. I'm looking to make a profit, you see, and six coins is all I can afford to pay.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I can't let these fine apples go for such a song. How about 5 coins? A fair price for both of us.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What do you say, Lennon, 4 coins for this fine selection of apples? A steal, I tell ya!
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 4 coins is a bit steep, don't you think? How about 3.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, meet me halfway. How about 3.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "3.5 coins, Lennon. It's a fair price for such fine fruit.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I can't let these fine apples go for such a song. How about 5 coins? A fair price for both of us.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What do you say, Lennon, 4 coins for this fine selection of apples? A steal, I tell ya!
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price between 4 and 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price closer to 4 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 4 coins is a bit steep, don't you think? How about 3.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price closer to 4 coins, perhaps 3.75.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, meet me halfway. How about 3.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "3.5 coins, Lennon. It's a fair price for such fine fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should accept Cedric's offer of 3.5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, how about four and a half coins? That's all I can manage.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly higher than Della Plumstone's offer, perhaps 4.75 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price closer to 4.5 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I can't go that low. How about 4.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. They are currently negotiating a price, with Della offering 3 coins and Lennon countering at 4 coins. The current date and time is September 15, 1895, between 00:10 and 00:15.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. They are currently negotiating a price, with Della offering 3 coins and Lennon countering at 4 coins. The current date and time is September 15, 1895, between 00:10 and 00:15.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they overheard their parents arguing about money. They felt a surge of protectiveness towards their mother, who seemed fragile and overwhelmed. Lennon started secretly selling wildflowers they picked from the meadow, using the earnings to buy her small gifts, a silent attempt to ease her burden.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they started working at the local market, helping a fruit vendor with his stall. Lennon quickly learned to identify different varieties of fruit, judge their ripeness, and haggle with customers. Their sharp wit and knowledge impressed the vendor, who eventually entrusted Lennon with running the stall on their own.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they decided to leave their hometown and travel the world, selling fruit from distant lands. They packed a small cart with their meager savings and a collection of tools, their heart filled with both excitement and trepidation.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than 4 coins, perhaps 3.75.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should accept Della's offer of 3 coins.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, how about four and a half coins? That's all I can manage.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly higher than Della Plumstone's offer, perhaps 4.75 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price closer to 4.5 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I can't go that low. How about 4.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins


          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit to Della Plumstone at the market in Fruitville. They are currently negotiating a price, with Della offering 3 coins and Lennon previously countering at 4 coins.
          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than 4 coins, perhaps 3.75.
          Time
        • 1895-09-15 00:10:00
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Lennon Figtree observed: Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 0
      Lennon Figtree: 0
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': '3 coins', 'Lennon Figtree': 'reject'}

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 4 coins

          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she began helping her mother at the family fruit stall in the marketplace. Della had a natural talent for arranging the fruit in an aesthetically pleasing manner, and her gentle demeanor attracted customers who appreciated her quiet charm. This experience ignited her love for the art of trade and the joy of connecting with people.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she began traveling with her father on his fruit-buying expeditions to distant orchards. She learned the intricacies of selecting the ripest fruit, negotiating fair prices, and building relationships with growers. This experience nurtured her entrepreneurial spirit and her appreciation for the bounty of the land.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.

          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 3 coins
          (c) 1 coin
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (e)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player

          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should offer Lennon Figtree a price of 4 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What do you say, Lennon, 4 coins for this fine selection of apples? A steal, I tell ya!
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 4 coins is a bit steep, don't you think? How about 3.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should offer Lennon Figtree a price that is slightly higher than his cost, leaving room for negotiation.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, meet me halfway. How about 3.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should counter Lennon Figtree's offer of 3 coins with a price of 3.5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "3.5 coins, Lennon. It's a fair price for such fine fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 3 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I can't go that low. How about 4.

          Cedric Meadowbrook's The current date/time is:
          16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della has offered 4 coins for the peaches, and Cedric must decide whether to accept or reject the offer. The current date and time is September 16, 1895, between 12:10 AM and 12:15 AM.
          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della has offered 4 coins for the peaches, and Cedric must decide whether to accept or reject the offer. The current date and time is September 16, 1895, between 12:10 AM and 12:15 AM.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, they convinced their father to let them help with the family fruit stall. Cedric was a natural salesman, charming customers with their infectious enthusiasm and knowledge of the fruits' origins and flavors. They even devised a new display method, arranging the fruit in a pyramid shape that drew in customers from afar.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, they bartered for a crate of rare, fragrant mangoes from a traveling merchant. Cedric experimented with different ways to preserve the mangoes, eventually perfecting a drying technique that allowed them to be enjoyed for months. This success fueled Cedric's belief in their ability to innovate and bring new experiences to their community.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I can't let these fine apples go for such a song. How about 5 coins? A fair price for both of us.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke.           Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your peaches, but three coins is more than I can afford.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-16 00:10:00.


          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins


          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della has offered 4 coins for the peaches, which Cedric must now accept or reject.
          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Cedric Meadowbrook do next in this situation?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook should accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins.
          Time
        • 1895-09-16 00:10:00
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 0
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': '4 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'reject'}

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 2 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 2 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree is a shrewd businesswoman.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price closer to 4.5 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly higher than Della Plumstone's offer, perhaps 4.75 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I can't go that low. How about 4.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, how about four and a half coins? That's all I can manage.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than 4 coins, perhaps 3.75.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should accept Della's offer of 3 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these are the finest peaches you'll find in all of Fruitville. Three coins, and they're yours.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your peaches, but three coins is more than I can afford.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "1.5 coins for the lot, Lennon. A fair price for such fine fruit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should accept Cedric's offer.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than Cedric's offer, perhaps 1.25 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "1.25 coins, Cedric. That's all I can afford.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd businesswoman.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than 4 coins, perhaps 3.75.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should accept Della's offer of 3 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these are the finest peaches you'll find in all of Fruitville. Three coins, and they're yours.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your peaches, but three coins is more than I can afford.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "1.5 coins for the lot, Lennon. A fair price for such fine fruit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should accept Cedric's offer.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than Cedric's offer, perhaps 1.25 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "1.25 coins, Cedric. That's all I can afford.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-17 00:10:00.


          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at the market in Fruitville and is negotiating a price of 1.25 coins for the lot.
          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should accept Cedric's offer of 1.5 coins.
          Time
        • 1895-09-17 00:10:00
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept

          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 3 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, how about four and a half coins? That's all I can manage.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I can't go that low. How about 4.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your peaches, but three coins is more than I can afford.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these are the finest peaches you'll find in all of Fruitville. Three coins, and they're yours.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should offer Della Plumstone a price of 3 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and ambitious traveling merchant.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook should accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 2 coins.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook should accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 2 coins.

      • Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Cedric Meadowbrook do next in this situation?
          Key

        • Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Cedric Meadowbrook do next in this situation?
          Answer

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins


          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. Lennon has offered 1.25 coins, but Cedric wants 1.5 coins for the fruit.
          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Cedric Meadowbrook do next in this situation?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook should accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 2 coins.
          Time
        • 1895-09-17 00:10:00
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Lennon Figtree observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
      Lennon Figtree: 3.0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 1.0
      Joint action
    • {'Lennon Figtree': '2 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'accept'}

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. You know I always give you a good deal, but I can't just give them away.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "They are fine peaches, Lennon, but six coins is a bit steep, don't you think? I can only afford four.

It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering.
